nl: Suppose $a, b \in R^k$. Find $c \in R^k$ and $r > 0$ such that $|x-a|=2|x-b|$ if and only if $| x - c | = r$. Prove that $3c = 4b - a$ and $3r = 2 |b - a|$.
candidate: ∀ {R : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup R] (k : ℕ) (a b x : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin k)) : ∃ (c : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin k)) (r, ℝ), (‖x - a‖ = 2 * ‖x - b‖ ↔ ‖x - c‖ = r) ∧ (3 • c = 4 • b - a) ∧ (3 * r = 2 * ‖b - a‖)
